attributes.action: Introduce Black History into Primary and Secondary education
attributes.additional_details: To help spread awareness for history of minorities embedded in our cultures and societies. Awareness and the ability for empathy and understanding of different cultures comes with education. With all the controversy surrounding minorities both here and abroad it is clear that the time has come to make education in these matters a part of our curriculum to help ease tensions and unite the people of our country.
attributes.background: Pass an education bill that introduces Black History as a mandatory part of the syllabus for primary and secondary school students.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign: 

 

Add education on diversity and racism to all school curriculums: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323808 

 

Making the UK education curriculum more inclusive of BAME history: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323961 

 

Teach Britain's colonial past as part of the UK's compulsory curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324092
